{"step_by_step_thinking": "Haemostatic agents are used to stop bleeding. Freeze dried bone, ferric sulphate, and collagen are all used as haemostatic agents. Calcium hydroxide, on the other hand, is not typically used as a haemostatic agent. It is more commonly used in dentistry as a pulp capping agent or as a root canal sealer.", "answer_choice": "B"}
